new.addfailed: The backend could not be added: __why__
new.addsuccess: The backend was added. Please open the details to configure

statistics.helpcontent: This panels lists the average on IOPS, Read and Write Speed and Cache Hits over 5 seconds summarized for all vDisks in the Cluster. The values are updated automatically every 5 seconds.
statistics.title: vDisk Statistics

vpools.helpcontent: The vPool panel lists all the vPools registered in the Open vStorage Cluster. For each vPool the matching Storage Routers and their statuses are displayed.
vpools.title: vPools

delete.delete: Are you sure you want to delete Domain '__what__'?

generic.access_right_resolution: Access is implicitly denied. However, if the logged in client has an active manage role, access is implicitly granted. An explicit deny wins over any grant. Users logging in into the GUI always use the Access Rights of the user. A grey tick indicates implicit rights, a dark tick indicates explicit rights.

api_errors.rate_limit_timeout: Waiting for API rate-limit lock to be released
api_errors.unavailable_call: The call is unavailable in the relay

login.introduction: Please provide the required credentials to log in into your Open vStorage management center.

login.welcome: Use the navigation to browse through the interface.

notfound.introduction: The page you've requested was not found. Please navigate back, and try again or update your bookmarks.
notfound.title: Page not found

general.dedupe_help_message: Deduplication will calculate an MD5 sum for each write resulting in performance loss, but better cache performance
general.dtl_help_message: Copies unprotected data in the write buffer of a vDisk to another Storage Router
general.mds_help_message: OpenvStorage will always run a master MDS in the same Domain as configured for the StorageRouter. In case a Recovery Domain is configured, additional MDS slaves will be configured in that Recovery Domain (safety of 2 and more)

rescan.inprogress: The disks of this Storage Router are being rescanned

detail.edit: Edit some properties of this Storage Router

moveaway.warning: Are you sure you want to move all vDisks away?

detail.moveawaymsg: Move all vDisks away from this Storage Router and start them on other Storage Routers.

offline.done_msg: The Storage Router was marked offline
offline.pendingmsg: The Storage Router is being marked offline
offline.title: Warning
offline.warning: Please make sure the Storage Router is actually down and unavailable before marking the Storage Router as offline. Marking the Storage Router as offline while it is still available might lead to data corruption.

refresh.inprogress: The hardware capabilities of this Storage Router are being refreshed

detail.refreshtt: Refresh the hardware capabilities of this Storage Router

detail.title: Storage Router

information.description: Open vStorage has the option to send regular heartbeats with metadata to a centralized server. The heartbeat data can be inspected at the bottom of this page. Additionally, you can enable remote access which enables the Open vStorage support team to access your environment upon your request through a secured tunnel.
information.title: Support Information

settings.saved_msg: The settings have been successfully applied
settings.title: Support Settings

title: Open vStorage

updates.collective_updates_at_broke: Update functionality depends on 'at' to be running properly. This appears not to be the case on all StorageRouters

gather_config.advanced_warning:
Configuring these settings can help shape the Open vStorage Volumedriver to your specific needs.

When settings these parameters, make sure to understand their impact towards the backend and its preset. Improperly configured settings can cause performance loss!
gather_config.cache_no_proxies: No proxies can be deployed making use of local Cache with current Global Write Buffer size
gather_config.cache_too_small: Only __amount__ prox__multiple__ can be deployed making use of local Cache with current Global Write Buffer size
gather_config.calculate_message: Adjusting the Volume Writer Buffer will set the parameters below to a standard. Reconfigure any of the parameters below will update the Volume Write Buffer.
gather_config.non_disposable_factor_too_small:
Nondisposable SCO factor must be at least __minimal_number__.
Please do so by adjusting the "__scos_per_tlog__" and/or "__volume_write_buffer__" parameters
gather_config.non_disposable_factor_help:
The nondisposable SCO factor determines the maximum amount of non-disposable data permitted for this volume.

Volume write buffer = SCO size * Number of SCOs in tlog * nondisposable SCO factor

confirm.failure_msg: Failed to generate configuration files for vPool __vpool__: __why__
confirm.instruction_steps:
• Copy the .tgz file to the correct node
  • Extract the .tgz (tar xzvf <filename> -C /etc/hprm)
  • Enable the HPRM service (systemctl enable hprm@__identifier__.service)
  • Start the HPRM service (systemctl start hprm@__identifier__.service)
